children.subject: You can do that, but better not. For most cases, if you are able to define your table in a reasonable way, you don't need to include a table. If you have to and you want to, you can do that. But maybe spend some time thinking of a better wording for the definition. Basically we will grade based on your definition.

You mean fill in a table for a specific example?

We won't look at it so the best approach is as Tiancheng said: explain briefly in words what you're trying to do.
Is it helpful to include a table in our homework as well?

history.content:
Please submit the pseudocode code instead of actual code for the part c of the DP problem (for both homework and exam).

If you want us to help you with DP problems, please give us your definition of DP table / recurrence and your thought on the problem so that we will be able to see where you are doing correct or wrong. It's not helpful if you are showing us the code.

The same for other algorithm problems. Try to explain your algorithm without much code.

Thanks!

#pin
history.subject: Notes on Homework/Exam and Piazza Questions
